##Page 1
#Page1Line1-0#		Odongo and Apiyo lived in the city with their
#Page1Line1-1#		father.
#Page1Time1#		4.1
#Page1Line2-0#		They looked forward to the holidays.|
#Page1Line2-1#		Not just because school was closed,| but 
#Page1Line2-2#		because they went to visit their grandmother.
#Page1Time2#		7.6
#Page1Line3#		She lived in a fishing village near a large lake.
#Page1Time3#		4.0
 
##Page 2
#Page2Line1-0#		Odongo and Apiyo were excited because it was
#Page2Line1-1#		time to visit their grandmother again.
#Page2Time1#		4.9
#Page2Line2-0#		The night before,| they packed their bags and
#Page2Line2-1#		got ready for the long journey to her village.
#Page2Time2#		4.2
#Page2Line3-0#		They could not sleep and talked the whole
#Page2Line3-1#		night about the holiday.
#Page2Time3#		3.6
 
##Page 3
#Page3Line1-0#		Early the next morning,| they left for the village
#Page3Line1-1#		in their father's car.
#Page3Time1#		5.0
#Page3Line2-0#		They drove past mountains,| wild animals and tea
#Page3Line2-1#		plantations.
#Page3Time2#		4.5
#Page3Line3#			They counted cars and sang songs.
#Page3Time3#		2.7
 
##Page 4
#Page4Line1-0#		After a while,| the children were tired and fell
#Page4Line1-1#		asleep.
#Page4Time1#		4.2
 
##Page 5
#Page5Line1-0#		Father woke Odongo and Apiyo as they arrived
#Page5Line1-1#		in the village.
#Page5Time1#		4.2
#Page5Line2-0#		They found Nyar-Kanyada,| their grandmother,
#Page5Line2-1#		resting on a mat under a tree.
#Page5Time2#		5.77
#Page5Line3-0#		Nyar-Kanyada| in Luo,| means 'daughter of the
#Page5Line3-1#		people of Kanyada'.
#Page5Time3#		5.1
#Page5Line4#		She was a strong| and beautiful woman.
#Page5Time4#		2.7
 
##Page 6
#Page6Line1-0#		Nyar-Kanyada welcomed them into the house|
#Page6Line1-1#		and danced around the room singing with joy.
#Page6Time1#		5.8
#Page6Line2-0#		Her grandchildren were excited to give her
#Page6Line2-1#		the presents they brought from the city.
#Page6Time2#		4.85
#Page6Line3-0#		"First open my gift,"| said Odongo.|
#Page6Line3-1#		"No,| my gift first!"| said Apiyo.
#Page6Time3#		5.57
 
##Page 7
#Page7Line1-0#		After she opened the presents,| Nyar-Kanyada
#Page7Line1-1#		blessed her grandchildren in a traditional way.
#Page7Time1#		5.9
 
##Page 8
#Page8Line1-0#		Then,| Odongo and Apiyo went outside.|
#Page8Line1-1#		They chased butterflies and birds.
#Page8Time1#		5.44
 
##Page 9
#Page9Line1-0#		They climbed trees and splashed in the
#Page9Line1-1#		water of the lake.
#Page9Time1#		4.0
 
##Page 10
#Page10Line1-0#		When it was dark,| they returned to the house
#Page10Line1-1#		for dinner.
#Page10Time1#		3.0
#Page10Line2-0#		Before they could finish eating,| they were
#Page10Line2-1#		falling asleep!
#Page10Time2#		3.48
 
##Page 11
#Page11Line1-0#		The next day,| the children's father drove back
#Page11Line1-1#		to the city leaving them with Nyar-Kanyada.
#Page11Time1#		5.9
 
##Page 12
#Page12Line1-0#		Odongo and Apiyo helped their grandmother
#Page12Line1-1#		with household chores.
#Page12Time1#		4.23
#Page12Line2#		They fetched water and firewood.
#Page12Time2#		2.4
#Page12Line3-0#		They collected eggs from the chickens,| and
#Page12Line3-1#		picked greens from the garden.
#Page12Time3#		4.9
 
##Page 13
#Page13Line1-0#		Nyar-Kanyada taught her grandchildren
#Page13Line1-1#		to make soft ugali to eat with stew.
#Page13Time1#		5.65
#Page13Line2-0#		She showed them how to make coconut rice
#Page13Line2-1#		to eat with roast fish.
#Page13Time2#		4.25
 
##Page 14
#Page14Line1-0#		One morning,| Odongo took his grandmother's cows
#Page14Line1-1#		to graze.| They ran into the neighbour's farm.
#Page14Time1#		6.86
#Page14Line2-0#		The farmer was angry with Odongo.| He threatened
#Page14Line2-1#		to keep the cows from eating his crops.
#Page14Time2#		5.75
#Page14Line3-0#		After that day,| the boy made sure that the
#Page14Line3-1#		cows did not get into any trouble again.
#Page14Time3#		5.73
 
##Page 15
#Page15Line1-0#		On another day,| the children went to the
#Page15Line1-1#		market place with Nyar-Kanyada.
#Page15Time1#		4.65
#Page15Line2-0#		She had a stall selling vegetables,|
#Page15Line2-1#		sugar and soap.
#Page15Time2#		4.1
#Page15Line3-0#		Apiyo liked to tell customers the price of items.|
#Page15Line3-1#		Odongo would pack the items that the customers bought.
#Page15Time3#		6.7
 
##Page 16
#Page16Line1-0#		At the end of the day| they drank
#Page16Line1-1#		chai tea together.
#Page16Time1#		3.3
#Page16Line2-0#		They helped grandmother to count
#Page16Line2-1#		the money she'd earned.
#Page16Time2#		3.0
 
##Page 17
#Page17Line1-0#		But too soon the holidays were over,| and
#Page17Line1-1#		the children had to go back to the city.
#Page17Time1#		5.0
#Page17Line2-0#		Nyar-Kanyada gave Odongo a cap,|
#Page17Line2-1#		and Apiyo a sweater.
#Page17Time2#		4.79
#Page17Line3#		She packed food for their journey.
#Page17Time3#		1.7
 
##Page 18
#Page18Line1-0#		When their father came to fetch them,| they
#Page18Line1-1#		did not want to leave.
#Page18Time1#		3.45
#Page18Line2-0#		The children begged Nyar-Kanyada| to go with
#Page18Line2-1#		them to the city.
#Page18Time2#		3.85
#Page18Line3#		She smiled and said,| "I am too old for the city."
#Page18Time3#		3.25
#Page18Line4-0#		"I will be waiting for you to come to my village
#Page18Line4-1#		again."
#Page18Time4#		2.8
 
##Page 19
#Page19Line1-0#		Odongo and Apiyo both hugged her tightly
#Page19Line1-1#		and said goodbye.
#Page19Time1#		4.38
 
##Page 20
#Page20Line1-0#		When Odongo and Apiyo went back to school they
#Page20Line1-1#		told their friends about life in the village.
#Page20Time1#		5.63
#Page20Line2-0#		Some children felt that life in the city was good.|
#Page20Line2-1#		Others felt that the village was better.
#Page20Time2#		5.73
#Page20Line3-0#		But most of all,| everyone agreed that Odongo
#Page20Line3-1#		and Apiyo had a wonderful grandmother!
#Page20Time3#		7.2
